subject: Psychology
title: The Power of Situational Kindness
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Power of Situational Kindness.

hook.text: People who found a dime in a phone booth were far more likely to help a stranger pick up dropped papers. A dime.

buildup.text: Isen and Levin's classic study showed that small positive events dramatically increase helping behavior.

discovery.text: Good moods expand attention, increase approach behavior, and make the world feel safer â€” all of which promote helping.

twist.text: This means kindness is partly situational. On a good day, everyone's more generous. On a bad day, less so.

climax.text: Designing environments that create small positive moments can systematically increase prosocial behavior.

punchline.text: A small boost in mood creates a big boost in kindness.

quiz.question: What did the dime study by Isen and Levin show?
options: Small positive events increase helping behavior
Mood has no effect on prosocial behavior
